Reviews.Title: “Good location for a night's rest”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I chanced upon this hotel as I was walking along Victoria St. on a previous visit to Singapore. I decided to give it a try when I had a one day stop in Singapore on my way to my final destination. A good location close to Bugis Junction. Iluma. Raffles City with eating places all around. It is basic and reasonably clean. Reception is at the end of the hallway as you enter the building from Victoria St. What surprised me was that you had to walk out the back entrance to get to the elevator. The room I got was small and cramped. Just suitable for a shower and one night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the Heart of Bugis”
Reviews.Author: Sheldon S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only 1 night because we were disappointed with our hotel also in Bugis area. The plus of this hotel is that there is a Bus Station outside the hotel which is very accessible. There's also a 7/11 below the hotel. The price is average since it is located near the city. The hotel rooms are clean and modern. Down side is that the rooms are small and the elevator is quite slow. Staff is not too accommodating. They have complementary internet access. Though no free breakfast. Infront of the hotel is Bras Basah Complex where there is a food center which is very affordable. I might stay here again when I go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Office staff”
Reviews.Author: muravar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2012. The price of the hotel is definetely good compared to expensive hotels in Singapore. Room was clean. The hotels location for its price is very good. Ginny and the other night staff that I cannot remember his name was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: APottinger
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the fact that the receptionist suggests you get cabs or tubes everywhere- we walked! It's only a short walk from little India, Arab street, just around the corner from orchard street and a stones throw from raffles - we even strolled into china town. Lovely staff on the front desk - fridge in the room, clean bathroom ... And reasonable for Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Improving!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here about five times for one night. Singapore hotels are very expensive compared to the rest of S.E.Asia so for one night this place is fine. I always have a problem with the WIFI but the front fixes it. The location is the best thing, close to the boat quays.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value (for Singapore)”
Reviews.Author: Norrie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during short stopover in Singapore. Very good location - though from the airport take the MRT to City Hall - not the closest station but the quickest in terms of the network connections. Exterior is quite charming in a 'heritage' sort if way: old little hotel hemmed in by huge tower blocks. Reception staff at check-in were professional, polite and helpful. Single room was small and basic but adequate for the purpose. Disposable comb and toothbrush/paste was a nice touch forthe stopover trade. (One teabag and one coffee sachet seemed excessively frugal, though.) Had an early connection to make from Changi so was both inconvenienced and a little insulted to have someone sent to check the room before I was given 'permission' to leave (I'm a perfectly respectable sixty-year old). It is a hotel, after all, not a bail hostel - and not particularly cheap by other than Singapore standards. But a successful stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure”
Reviews.Author: Nguyen T
Reviews.Content: There was a lot of bed mites that bit me and everyone else. There is like 6 bits on my leg. Bathroom is a bit dodgy and in the shower there were a lot of bugs. But something that was convenient was that there was a 7-11 nearby and a food court across the street. It was quite poor though. There is no swimming pool or fitness centre

Reviews.Title: “Good location and improving!”
Reviews.Author: digtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before and found the staff to be unfriendly, this time I found the staff very friendly and helpful. I also commented on the lack of safety deposit boxes which are now in each room.

Reviews.Title: “clean & no frills”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: my 2nd time at victoria hotel. good wifi, good shower. very close to 7-11. could hear noises from the corridor. a/c made lots of noise. too bad victoria street hawker centre had shut down, had to walk to bugis food junction instead.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location but not good on rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jezz131
Reviews.Content: I was there for Christmas recently. The room looked neat when we checked in on the 1st night. But for the 2nd night, it was a disaster!! My bf was bitten by bed mites all over his body, neck and up to the side of his face. We have to wake up in the middle of the night and search for the bed mites entire the bed. Such a pity to him as the mite bites will grow into a big size red patches. The next morning, we found another 1 in the bathroom. I am not sure why the management did not managed to overcome this issue as I have seen the same comment over and over again. Receptionist never mentioned to switch us to another room. Hope this comment is useful to others.

Reviews.Title: “strategic!but price a little high”
Reviews.Author: KelvinPg
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a money exchanger on the left side of main entrance. it has a 7-Eleven shop at the right side. there is one western food shop at the lobby. for those who need hairstyling, the lobby has one shop. about 3 minutes to nearest mrt station called bras basah under circle line. this is advantage of this hotel. from bras basah one can go to dhoby gaut mrt station. orchard road station is just two station aways from dhoby gaut. chinatown and little india can be reached via the north east line that runs through dhoby gaut. my room was upgraded from standard to a deluxe double. it was small , just nice for one person. the tv was very small. room was clean though. air con was cold and temperature could not be adjusted. it blew direct to the person on the bed. so watch out!!! wifi was free. breakfast was not included. you do not need one from the hotel as food is easily available in vicinity. bras basah complex is just opposite this hotel. 10 minutes walk would take you to Raffles City. the receptionist was kind enough to keep trying to dial for cabs when i needed urgently. however, the breakdown of north-south mrt line made it almost impossible to get a cab instantly. she tried her very best. thumbs up! should opt for higher floor as sound from exhaust can be unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Practical hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: diizzee
Reviews.Content: If I am allowed only one word to review this hotel, it has to be "practical" !! It may not be as polished as a 5-star hotel (frills & fancies at 5-start hotel comes with a price), but it certainly has all the basics that is required in a room - coffee/tea making facilities, hairdryer, and even a safe. There is a family-like steak house, 7-Eleven (24-hour convenient store), and a money change just next to the hotel!! Only 5 minutes walk to Bras Basah MRT, and no worries on a rainy day, as one can walk along the covered walkway around SMU Admin Building. There was only a slight oversight in the housekeeping where the cups were not washed - these were just put back on to the tray :-( Note : Nearest MRT to Marina Bay Sands would be Promenade MRT. There is a free shuttle from this stop. Operating Hours (Weekdays 12noon - 3pm; 5-10pm; Weekends : 12noon - 10pm). Otherwise, it is about 15 minutes walk from Promenade MRT

Reviews.Title: “compact yet soo comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MMSteyn
Reviews.Content: this centrally placed hotel was the best choice i made on my trip to singapore....though a little small but did'nt comprimise on comfort..the rooms layout and furnishing was just right for us 2 sisters...if your looking for a hotel with friendly and helpfull staff and which is centrally located for you to come back and rest after shopping,also easy on the pockets,this place would be ideal

Reviews.Title: “Check for bed bugs before settling!”
Reviews.Author: itch2_11
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel despite the bad comments from other travellers with regards to bed bug, thinking that the hotel had promised to do constant pest control to prevent anymore bed bugs attack to guest. However, during the 2 nights, I started with a few bumps on my hand, thought they were just mosquito bites. However, on second nights, half of my face affect, and my neck and more bumps on my hand. Both of my husband hand affected too. Thank God my children were spared. The staff apologized but this experience is too undeserving. I have to pray hard that these creatures won't attach to our luggage or clothing home! What make me to comment here is the the problem continue despite the pest control promises and the future phobia I will have whenever checking into hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ol_blue
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Victoria. I found the front desk staff to be friendly and very helpful. My room, though small, was quite adequate for one person. I came here from Thailand, where they like their mattresses very firm, and I found my bed here to be firm but very comfortable. Unlike other recent reviewers, I saw no evidence of ants in my room. The hotel provides complimentary coffee/tea service in the room, as well as bottled water. The room has a small fridge and a small, wall-mounted flat screen TV. The channel selection is quite limited, but I don’t watch much TV anyway, so not a problem for me. I chose the Victoria based on previous reviews that touted it’s location and I agree that it’s easy to get anywhere in Singapore from here. It’s been four years since my last trip here and I was surprised at the increase in taxi fares. I arrived at the airport about 5 pm and took a taxi to the hotel. With the 35% rush hour surcharge, the fare was $38. As of today, 12 December, 2011, the basic taxi rates have gone up again, and the peak hours surcharge has changed. As I understand it from a driver, peak hours are 5 pm -midnight, and 5am- 9:30 am, and the surcharge has decreased to + 25% of the metered fare. Because the hotel is just a short walk from the Bras Basah MRT, I would recommend using the MRT from the airport if you’re traveling light and arrive during peak taxi hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Budget Hotel in Heritage Area”
Reviews.Author: Kiwisnowbirds
Reviews.Content: The hotel is entered by small entranceway from the road but opens to a larger reception area. Part of a larger hotel chain it is well run, clean friendly. Rooms are a good size by Singapore standards also clean and well maintained. Beds are comfortable and there is plenty of hot water. There are many food centres in the area and the Bras Basah MTR station is just around the corner. Bugis St and the Albert Centre all within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: soccer_crazy011
Reviews.Content: At first... I thought it was a very nice hotel... but it is not..... The first receptionist that welcomed us is not bad.... Also, one of the good thing about the place is, it is near a 7-eleven and got two computers in the lobby for anyone to use for free. However... the rooms are very small.... you can't barely move. Then when we first enter... the smell is bad. The bed was hard and the bedding and pillow cases are rough. At the middle of the night... we felt itchy! The bed must have a very strong chemicals or bed bugs.... There were not many channels to watch from their TV. Although the water, coffee and tea is free. At the shower....it is so hard to mix the hot and cold water... so it is really annoying... So next time go visit SG... Victoria Hotel is already CROSSED OUT from my list of hotels... Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1-2 nights....”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, centrally situated, staff were friendly and efficient. I had a standard room which was small but clean and tidy. Little bit noisy at night due to machinery noises but I was on 6th floor with the rooftop equipment directly above me. Recommend if staying for 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best you'll get for the money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DavidAstley
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 6 or 7 times in the past year, so I guess that's a recommendation in itself. But as I travel to Singapore a lot, often staying for a week or more, paying S$200-300 a night for a decent hotel would break the bank. Over the years I've tried just about everything there is in the S$100 a night price range in Singapore - and the Victoria Hotel is the only one to which I have returned. What I like about the Victoria Hotel is it's location. It's five minutes from Raffles City where there's lots of good shops and restaurants, and within walking distance of three MRT stations on three lines (Bras Basah - 4 mins, City Hall - 7 mins, Bugis - 10 mins). Although I am always there on business, tourists enjoy being close to Bugis Junction, and Orchard Road and Marina Bay Sands are just two stops away on the MRT (in different directions). Or you can walk to both if you are looking for some exercise. The Victoria Hotel is just down the road from the National Library where there is a Hanis Cafe which serves the best flat white in town (Illy coffee). It also serves cheap western meals, and there are hawker stalls in an adjacent building which sells even cheaper local food. The hotel has free wi-fi in all the rooms with good signal strength. It occasionally drops out, but a call to reception to ask them to reboot fixes the problem. The rooms are small but they are clean and have a separate shower cubicle in the bathroom (a rarity in hotels in this price range in Singapore). There is a fridge and TV in the room and the air- conditioners work well and not too noisy (split system type). There is a 7-11 store on the ground floor, a small restaurant and a money changer. So those are the pros. Now for the cons: Some of the rooms have a problem with small ants. From memory, they seem to be ones on lower floors. In many of the rooms there is a bad smell coming from the floor waste in the bathroom (if that bothers you, a quick trip to a pharmacy to buy a small bottle of Dettol will fix the problem temporarily). And the sound proofing of the doors is not that good, so if there are noisy early departures or revellers returning from late night drinking, sleep can be disturbed. But that's a problem in all cheap hotels in Singapore (in fact the Victoria Hotel is not as bad as most others as it has carpet on the floors of the corridors which helps to muffle the sound). The reception staff (with a couple of exceptions) are quite indifferent to your presence, but they do respond promptly to requests for assistance. The housekeeping staff have a much more friendly demeanour. On this particular trip I have been lucky - no ants in the room, no smell in the bathroom, and one of the reception staff actually smiled! I've been woken up earlier than I needed with housekeping staff starting work at 7.30am, but if you are an early riser thst wouldn't worry you. Some stays at the Victoria - like this one - have been good, but others not so good. So I've based my ratings on an average of all stays.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & nice hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: SweetAppleLim
Reviews.Content: I stay 2 nights at this hotel & enjoy my stay at here. Check in process is very fast with agoda hotel voucher. I stay at the highest floor (6th floor) of the hotel with window and have a good water pressure in the bathroom. The room is small but is clean & adequate for 2 person stay. The hotel is in victoria street with lots of shopping mall (Bugis Junction, Bugis Street & etc) & food courts around. 7-11 store just on the ground floor & across the road there is a 24 hours food court. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, Bras Basah MRT station just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “yes it is very small but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: 007sg
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a single room. Yes it was tiny compared to most other hotels but if you go in expecting it, you will be ok. One single bed with a wheelchair bathroom ( it was all that was available) so bathroom was quite roomy. The room had a small window with a parking lot as a view. Staff were indifferent, could care less if I was there or not. There is no breakfast, my room was quiet with ice cold air con. Very basic for the money I paid $100AUD. But i was only there to sleep and it was comfortable. It is very close to shops and MRT as in 5 to 10 min walk. Bugis village is also close with good cheap hawker meals. Be aware that not much opens till 10am so have a sleep in. I spent hours walking around waiting for things to happen and open when I could of been sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: OxfordKimberly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Victoria Hotel for 2 nights over the last weekend. The location of this hotel is very convenient. It is 5 mins walk to the closest station (Bras Basah) which is one of the stops of the Circle line. And one block further (10 mins walk) to another station City Hall which you can go to different lines. Chijmes is very close to the hotel. The room is right size for me (I stayed at a standard room with one bed). Not too small to me. There are 2 windows but one faces to the wall and the other is the back alley. Everything in the room is very basic. The shampoo is for both bath and hair washing. Luckily I brought my own set of shampoo and conditioning. Having read the comments here about bed bugs, I checked my bed once I moved in and did so on the second night. The bed was clean so I was relieved to sleep on it. The staff are ok. When I checked out, it was raining heavily. One of the Chinese staff asked me if I wanted to call a taxi to the airport. In fact I had some place to go before heading to the airport. He was pleased to help me to call for a taxi and said that it was his job.

Reviews.Title: “Barely hospitable, awful service, mosquito infestation...”
Reviews.Author: no_go_victoria
Reviews.Content: We've always used Victoria Hotel as our base in Singapore and stayed here once in 2009, and twice here this year. Unfortunately, our stay this time round has been really disappointing. Because there are no carpets on the room floors, everyday starting 9am you'll hear the scraping of furniture as the housekeeping staff begin cleaning the rooms. So no chance of ever sleeping in. In addition, the housekeeping staff also use really loud walkie-talkies that can be heard down the hallway and into the rooms. However, the two housekeeping staff I met were really friendly and nice, a stark contrast to the indifferent and clueless counter staff. We were on the 5th floor for 4 days last week and the wireless internet worked spottily. We're currently staying on another floor and there seems to be no problem. The mainland Chinese tourists staying at the hotel also seem quite unfamiliar with typical hotel etiquette, smoking in their rooms with the AC on. When we called down to the counter staff to complain about the smell, they brushed us off. We're now using blankets to keep the smoke out from under our door. Apparently, there's been an increasing number of reports of bedbugs at this hotel over the last year. We didn't experience any but I received a few mosquito bites every night that I had stayed here. Stay here if you absolutely have better use for your money. Otherwise, if you prize privacy and comfort, fork out the extra change for somewhere else more appreciative of your patronage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: AllTravelNoWork
Reviews.Content: Being in Singapore for a quick stopover I wanted a place that was centrally located, clean and somewhat affordable. The room was very clean and just the right size for a short stay. The staff was helpful and very rule abiding. For a noon checkout they call your room at 11:50 if you are not checked out yet. When they say noon, they mean business. No possibility of late checkouts, FYI. The location was good with easy access to most parts of the city and easily accessible to the train/bus system. Was pretty easy to get to/from airport on public transit. I'd stay here again for a quick stopover. If you stay here I'd recommend visiting the food stall one block directly behind the hotel. The staff helped me find it and it was great! Good cheap local food, close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Itchy_in_Singapore
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both woke up itching and found bed bugs crawling all over both beds, on the sheets and pillows and under the sheets. The hotel didn't compensate us other than by moving us to another room. The management also told us that they would spray the room and wash the sheets. They didn't seem to understand when we told them that the only way to eradicate the bedbugs is to dispose of the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nalavade
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel nice and clean, its a budget hotel, I happened to stay here in a package tour with my family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Singapore close to MRT stations”
Reviews.Author: JM00
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore Singapore. Excellent value and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: fantax06
Reviews.Content: Have researched for a while before deciding on this hotel. Went there with my partner for a conference (Suntec), it is RIGHT NEXT to the Bugis station, super convenient, within walking distance from LOTS of shopping centers. One of the cheapest one in that area with FREE WIFI available inside the room. Reception is very friendly. It claimed to be a 2-stars, the facilities are ok (like air-conditioning) but I would say around a 3-star for its cleanliness and free water in the fridge :) Great for young couples who is looking to tour around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, central location...”
Reviews.Author: viroze
Reviews.Content: Have been a frequent visitor for 3 times now, mostly for conventions and short trips. The room is clean as always with tiny LCD, basic toiletries, towels and surprisingly almost 4 star quality bedding for the price you pay. The free wifi can be a bit of hiccups depending on which room you're staying, not forgetting the window view. MRT and main shopping location is just 5-10 mins walk. This small hotel is located in between 7 eleven and a university, so its quite a safe area for a walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “small room, free wi-fi, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: rocklady
Reviews.Content: SMALL, clean room with free wi-fi in the room. There were also a couple of computers in the lobby for people to use - not sure whether it was free or a nominal charge. Some rooms have a window looking out to the building next door, but how much time do you spend in a room. The location was the best. Within walking distance from the Bugis Station and lots of eateries in the area. The subway was clean and efficient. You just need to get someone to show you how to use it. The S'poreans are the friendliest people! If you are only in the city for a few days, don't bother with any EZ travel or Tourist Card...buy the single ride when you need it. Most rides are only about $1.Next to the hotel is a great beef restaurant - large slabs of meat at a reasonable price. We had breakfast out everyday - no problem finding food courts. Taxi from airport to hotel $20-22. The subway does connect up with the airport, but it was not at the terminal where we arrived. We will be returning to S'pore in 2 weeks and will write again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: 70sGrrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights on a holiday, 1st time in Singapore. The best thing about the Victoria is the location. Walk to Bugis Village markets and Raffles hotel, $1 bus fare to Chinatown, Marina Bay Sands, etc. Rooms were small - I had a double by myself and it would have seemed crowded with two people. Decor is a bit tired, however my room was clean and the shower was hot, with TV, fridge and kettle all provided. Staff were efficient and knowledgeable when asked questions but not especially helpful otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fair Value, Indifferent Service”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2112
Reviews.Content: The location is really good, right next to the MRT and an easy walk to Chijmes for (expensive) nightlife. The rooms are REALLY small, apparently I was upgraded so I can only imagine the size of room I would have had otherwise. Free internet was fast enough for Skype video calls home. The room was very clean, although unfortunately the cleaning staff shout to each other down the hall so it can be quite noisy - I actually thought it was a Chinese tour group until I stuck my head into the corridor to see what was going on. Like another reviewer, I arrived early and was informed that checkin time was 2pm. Since I arrived at 1:55pm I thought this was ridiculous. They handed over the key anyway, I guess they allowed me 5 mins to wait for the elevator. There is a very cheap food court across the road, $4 for lemon chicken and rice.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with with an annoying policy!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times and I am booked to stay two more time in the future. I think it is the best value for a short stay and in a very good location. What I found annoying was that I arrived at 9am and was told I would have to pay $30 to go to the room early. I asked if it was the same room that I would get if I waited until 1200 and was told yes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms dark and cramped”
Reviews.Author: terbang
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels are expensive, so don't expect too much. Rooms here are small, cramped and the view is towards a brick wall only five feet away, so it's really dark. But it's clean enough and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price but...”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyBlue1225
Reviews.Content: First, we like this hotel. Good location, walk 2-3 minutes to MRT. Room was small but ok it's in Sinpapore, reasonable price. The bad thing was, we got bed bugs. When we first found some bugs on the bed, we're worried but we didn't really think it's a big deal. Until they came home with our suitcases. My mother and her bf stayed in another room, they're fine. But my husband and I both got bad reaction. After we went to doctor for 2 times to cure our skin, we still had to wash and dry the whole room of clothes, bought chemical to kill the bugs in the house...etc. It's a total disaster, but at least our 1 year old son didn't get bit by the bugs. THANK GOD. We really hope they already clean all the rooms so nobody would have to suffer this like us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Kendra19
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean. Bugis and Bras Basah MRT is walking distance, bus stop is right in front of hotel. Free internet access on the lobby and the staff are nice. Overall very convenient and a nice place to stay. Wish breakfast was included :)

Reviews.Title: “Small But Good”
Reviews.Author: PJ28
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a tad on the small side to say the least, they are clean, quiet, have windows, free wi fi & it is easy to get to from the airport

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quite clean, small but nice and VERY CONVENIENT!”
Reviews.Author: azeng
Reviews.Content: Very simple check-in, small but nice rooms, very very quiet but location is very good. 3mins walk to metro, and food court and many shopping centres everywhere within 10mins walk. Also really convenient, with steak-house, money exchanger and seven-eleven in the hotel building. Good for people on a budget and great value!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: princessJxoxo
Reviews.Content: My mum and i travelled to Singapore for a shopping escapade. When i booked this hotel, we were a little worried that it might not be as good as the other reviews have mentioned. However, we were both pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. The sheets in the room were clean, the toilet and shower were clean. The location of the hotel is really good as it is near to Bugis area as well Bras Basah MRT station. It is also not too far away to orchard road (less than $10) by taxi. However, the walls of the room were pretty thin so we could hear the neighbours' talking and laughing and moving their stuff around. That is the only downside for our stay. Because of that, our sleep quality was reduced. The room was also a little smaller (less walking space) than regular twin hotel rooms. However, this hotel is good if you plan on spending most of the time outside of the hotel and only return for sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “old but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: leniaDenpasar
Reviews.Content: when i arrived in spore,i thought i will find this hotel in no time,since its located on the big street..but i was wrong!..since this hotel is not so famous..so i have to walk and using the map and my gut feeling as my guide to find it..it was small..but very clean and nice,,it got everythings that we need.the hotel staff are very friendly and efficient..so i dont have to wait long just to get into my room.the hotel is close to bugis market,and there is a food stall near by,so if u dont pay for breakfast at the hotel,dont wory! the nearest mrt station is in bugis juction (about 10 minutes MY speed) but the bus station is located just outside the hotel! and theres a seven eleven and a steak restaurant and a beauty salon on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable place for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: wangxiaoyu
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit small but relatively clean and comfortable to sleep. I wish the bathroom could have been better. The staffs are polite and friendly.The hotel's location's quite good, I could walk to shops and the subway without any problem. I would give this hotel a 3.5/5, there are cons things like no views nor breakfast but its' reasonable for a place to rest during your traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Now what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: prw1970
Reviews.Content: Had a business meeting nearby and chose based on the price this hotel. The location was good for where I had to visit. I always get bed and breakfast rates whenever I travel and checked with their reservations desk that the rate was indeed bed and breakfast. I was assured that it was and also that a smoking room had been booked for me. Arrived to discover the whole hotel is non smoking and that they do not even have a restaurant . It was too late to change so stayed where I was. There was a small smoking area in front of the hotel and at the back. Restaurants couple next door were ok. There is a 7-11 shop next to it so can get your food etc there. The rate was cheap so probably should have guessed that you get what you paid for. The service was ok, the rooms small but clean and if you only need somewhere to sleep near to Suntec then for the price that I paid it is adequate. I would most likely when I return pay a bit more money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Busen
Reviews.Content: The best about this hotel is its location. The value for money is ok, considering the hotel prices in Singapore, but otherwise I don't think this hotel would be worth the money. Our room was quite ok, but it could have been bigger. The same applies to the bathroom, but both the room and the bathroom were clean. The furniture was a bit outdated, but there is some renovation going on at the moment. If you're looking for a clean hotel with a good location at a relatively reasonable price, then I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location, Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: holycap
Reviews.Content: If those three points are your concern, then the Victoria Hotel should suffice perfectly. This is especially true if your traveling party isn't beyond two people. The rooms are no frills, small, but clean enough. The beds can a bit rough/uncomfortable for some people, so it really depends on how many nights and how easy of a sleeper you are, but I personally didn't have any problems. As this particular hotel is well reviewed, you can expect what many others have pointed out. I'll add a few additional points for reinforcement: The "queen/deluxe" bedroom was really just two beds pressed together. Certain rooms will have a patio with chairs outside etc, but lets face it, you're in Singapore with weather that may not really put these patio to much use. Internet is provided by WiFi, while it was not slow, it certainly isn't super fast. No real complaints though as internet access is free. There's a restaurant of sort attached to the hotel front lobby, but you'll do better walking down to the food court / hawker centre just a few minutes to the east of the hotel, and if memory serves correctly, there are a few fast food 24/7 locations nearby. Location is good, as you're right downtown and about 5-10 minute walk to the nearest MRT. If you're not staying for an extremely long time and just need a value-oriented, clean place to spend a couple of nights, you can do worse than the Victoria Hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here over and over again.”
Reviews.Author: Shammasi-couple
Reviews.Content: You get exactly your money's worth. It's clean down town with free Wifi. The food court next door is not bad. And it's a five minute walk from the library and raffles hotel. Staff are friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average”
Reviews.Author: BettyFNQ
Reviews.Content: I've given it 3 but really is 3.5. Its was the most expensive hotel of our trip but we were expecting that being Singapore. Right near Bugis and a 24 hour Hawker centre so the location cannot be faulted. We think they are doing renovations at the moment which if so this hotel in 6 months could be quite a find - 1. the hall smelt of paint 2. one of the lifts was out of action so the way to the room was a little strange 3. the bathroom (which was massive!!! pay extra for a deluxe room!) had been regrouted recently 4. the fabric on the chairs didn't match the room at all which makes me think they are in the middle of revamping the rooms.. But our room was mostly clean. Housekeeping were friendly and efficient. Free internet downstairs and wifi in rooms. And as with all hotels in Asia free bottled water. Its such a simple touch but nice - why don't hotels in Oz do it? Crappy view but we just kept the curtain closed so who cares. I've read alot of reviews on here saying the rooms are small, my advice if you want more space pay for a deluxe. We had a bigger bathroom and an extra space with wardrobe, mini fridge, writing desk and stand thing. All up very comfortable for the price would probably stay again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely will stay again at victoria hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0setatt00
Reviews.Content: Victoria Hotel is conveniently located at the heart of the city. Going to the Esplanade and the merlion is just a walking distance. There are buses that would take you to the Orchard shopping center, Little India, Clarke Quay and Chinatown just infront of victoria hotel. The Bugis market is just a 5 min walk.. there are also food courts nearby.. But what awed me most is the Bras Basah MRT station and the Singapore Art museum which are just a 2 min walk from the hotel.. The rooms are very small but very clean. Our room is facing the wall of the other hotel which is not a good sight..When we got into a deep sleep, a loud banging of the door woke us up..But these doesn't matter at all. The hotel staff are very friendly and always there to cater your needs. I definitely will stay again at Victoria Hotel on my next visit to Singapore this time with my kids..

Reviews.Title: “Great value- but no thrills”
Reviews.Author: horsforthhe
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Victoria Hotel in the summer. First of all the pros. The location is great, slap bang in the middle of Singapore. I found my room to be clean and the staff pleasant enough. Now the cons. I found the bed too small (I'm 6ft4) and kept getting woken up by machinery by my bedroom window when I was trying to sleep. The room was small, had no carpet or bath- just a shower. As a result I wouldn't say the stay was the most comfortable I'd ever had but as I was out most of the time doing things it didn't bother me too much. If you are on a tight budget you might consider this but personally next time I would pay extra for a bit more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: traveler294265
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried after reading some reviews but had no problems. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a better room which was large, clean and comfortable (although the bathroom was pretty small). Location was excellent, close to Raffles and short walk to MRT. We were able to walk to alot of places, athough with the MRT and buses close by this isn't necessary. Staff were friendly and helpful. Good value (for Singapore). Free wifi with a good signal in the room.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, good location, worth money”
Reviews.Author: Tonhonmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Victoria hotel with family. the hotel staffs were very nice. They always tried to help and give travel advice. Room's not new but it's clean and comfortable. 10 mins walk to subway Bugis station. Bus stop in front of hotel. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jagurundi
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel in a great central location the Victoria is a good bet One of our rooms was fine while the other smelled of mildew and had a leak in roof of bathroom. Restaurants close by for breakfast along with 24 hr macdonald's and 7-11. So for about $90 US this hotel is a good value but very basic and again a great location

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of my entire month of Asia travel”
Reviews.Author: WoosterBertie
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer noted below, there are two types of room in this hotel: handicapped accessible rooms, and "normal" rooms. The handicapped accessible ones have a large bathroom, but the room itself is tiny - I can't conceive of anyone navigating it in a wheelchair. I'm willing to accept smaller hotel rooms in central Singapore, but this is beyond ridiculous - I've attached photos to show I'm not exaggerating. I'm 5'7", and only just fit in the tiny bed. Given what I paid (118 USD), I consider this hotel to be well into "scam" territory. What's more, when it started raining, a severe leak developed, which I slowed by covering it with bathroom towels (again, see photo). Perhaps there are rooms in the hotel that are not so dreadful - I don't know, since I wasn't given one. Certainly, there are MUCH better hotels at this price, and well located, in Singapore (I previously stayed in hotel 1929, which was fantastic, but unfortunately fully booked on the day I was there). Personally, I consider the hotel to be a dreadful ripoff - the MRT means you can pay the same for much better rooms, and still have good fast access to central Singapore. If you're still interested in staying here, at least call them up and insist on being given a proper room, and not one of their purportedly "handicapped accessible" ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Kay-bologna-zurich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite basic but has a great value for money. We stayed in a deluxe room, which was quite small, but fine for our needs. The hotel is organized in a strange way, the elevator is on a back street, the reception between a hairdresser and a restaurant and the "business area" is in the middle of the reception (free use of 2 computers connected to the internet). For us it was not a problem at all but it is better to be aware of this. Singapore is the safest place I have ever been to so having the elevator accessible from outside never made us feel in danger. There are many american style restaurants near the hotel where you can have breakfast. The Raffles hotel and Hall City mall are 5 minutes walk away, so you can find everything you need and go everywhere with the metro. A 7-11 shop is right next to the hotel. The bugis shopping area is 5 minutes walk away. The people at the reception were nice and helpful. there is a laundry service on request. If you are on a budget, this hotel is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest and worst room I've ever had but great location...2 stars”
Reviews.Author: JonnieS
Reviews.Content: Cons: 1) The room is about 8 X 10 feet which is the smallest hotel room I have ever seen or stayed in. The bathroom is equal size but it is fitted for handicapped uses. I have no ned for a handicapped bathroom so I would have preferred a larger room. 2) The room furnishings are old and dumpy, not attractive or appealing at all. The room has a safe but it is not bolted down. It is in a closet and could easily be picked up and carried away. How easy it would be to fix this. Pros: 1) Great location. The hotel is very convenient to the major attractions of Singapore. This is the one redeeming quality besides low price. I paid $102 SD per night and by Singapore standards that is low price. 2) The room has working AC, free internet access, two bottles of water, mini-fridge 3) The baggage man/driver in the lobby is at his post but is old and has been asleep every time I passed. This adds a certain ambiance and charm to the place. I'm only staying two nights so I got by but I wanted others to be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nshukla
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this Hotel. They do not have carpet in room. If you ask for any help after 06:00 PM, reception will tell you that you have to wait till 07:45 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FilipinoBusinessman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Agoda and got a really wonderful price of SGD98. It was a small but functional room with mini ref, hot water boiler, digital safe, small flat screen TV. There were 2 free water bottles, coffee, tea and even an instant oatmeal cereal drink. The bed was firm, which is good for comfortable sleeping. I didn't like the split air conditioner too much since its' temperature range wasn't stable and I was sweating one moment and freezing the next. The LCD TV was small, about 17 inches, but was enough for the world cup with my glasses on. The floor was clean enough to walk barefoot. The room I had though had a floor to ceiling window facing right into the bathroom so you have to close the sliding door or you may be an extra exhibition for the art museum next door. Don't forget to bring a UK/HK/Singapore plug adaptor since there are no flat plug outlets. There's a 7/11 in front and a hawker center at the front left so there's cheap food to be had. The Bras Basah SMRT is the closest station only about 200 meters from the back entrance. 3 Catholic churches within 200 meters.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel for the location.”
Reviews.Author: point_passenger
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last March 2010 for 4 days and 3 nights. Check-in was very quick. The location of the hotel is very good. There are a lot of nearby restaurants/ malls/ money changers. There is a money changer, 7-11 convenience store and restaurant right outside the hotel. It is near Bugis Shopping Village. They provide a free morning shuttle to Suntec. There are several bus stops near the hotel and across the street. There are two nearby mrt stations - bugis and city hall. Bugis is much nearer by foot. On a cool day or night, you can even walk to tourists spots from the hotel - like clarke quay. The rooms are very clean. They also clean it everyday upon your request and they replenish your toiletry/ bathroom stocks everyday even if you still have unused ones. They don't have room service though...and you can hear people walking along the hallways. Don't expect a good view from your room windows since the hotel is in between to buildings... Overall, if you just need a good place to sleep during the night after your non-stop tour in Singapore, this is a good hotel to stay in for the price...We booked via Agoda.com so we also saved some money.=)

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better!”
Reviews.Author: digtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and therefore could be a very good hotel. However it seems that the staff are prohibited from smiling or interacting with customers! There are also no in room safes and only passports can be left at reception, therfore you either have to leave valuables in your room or carry them with you. It also does not have a restaurant on site, so you have to head off to try and find breakfast! The single room was small but adequate, but the choice of TV stations was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel is budget is everything...”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: Victoria Hotel is located is a great spot for tourists. Close to Bugis, Little India, Marina Bay, Museums, etc. The hotel itself is quite old and it shows. The room are lack lustre and I would rate cleanliness in general as slightly below average. The hotel does not have parking in front so even cabs generally pull over to the next hotel ahead to park! The restaurant on the premises are nothing to write about.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaspi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over a week at this budget hotel,having to extend due to cancellation of my trip to Bangkok following the trouble there.First i would stay that this budget hotel is superbly located into the heart of the city of Singapore.It provides no breakfast but this is not a problem at all as just across the road you have the Coffee Express 2000 in the Bras Barah Complex which provide you a cheap coffee/cake at 3 SGD or if you proceed a few metres down the road you get the MC Donald with continental breakfast at around 6 SGD.The bus stops in front of the hotel and brings you quickly to the main places of interest/shopping area for at most SGD 2- The new Bras Basah MRT station just opened today is only 100 metres from the hotel (turn right on exiting the hotel and on first intersection turn right again you will see the MRT).In the evening you have a 24-hours-Open asian food court 50 metres to your left on exiting the hotel and 10 SGD will get you a meal +Soft Drinks.There is the Republic restaurant catering for more western taste with steak/burgers/fish n chips...just in front of the hotel, with the 7-11 shop for snacks ,newspapers,drinks and a money changer also nearby.Concerning the rooms,i have been able to change 3 times due to my extended trip and the best was on the 4th floor where there was carpet but no safe.On the 6th floor you get good sleep and a room safe if you go for a superior room.Avoid the 2nd floor as it is near a car park and the noise could be unbearable for a good sleep.Also on the lower floors you can see ants in the room, no such things on the upper floor rooms only some insects but as Singapore is a tropical country this is unavoidable and in no way a problem.Toileteries are offered daily as well as 2 water bottles +coffee-cereal,you have to do it yourself a kettle is provided. Overall the Victoria is a good choice for the no-thrills not so fussy traveller as good hotels in downtown Singapore starts from SGD 200-/day so better save on this to shop till you drop in the mega-malls.

Reviews.Title: “not too good”
Reviews.Author: metts
Reviews.Content: booked for 3 nights , but checked out after first night. would have left on arrival but after a long flight just had to sleep. A/C hardly worked ,so was hot and sweaty . Every thing in room was very damp in the morning. Small room and creepy crawlies on floor and walls.Glad to have left . Staff at reception never said thankyou/sorry / good bye when paying and leaving in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable but no safety deposit option, a must for all hotels.”
Reviews.Author: gdcc2
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in relation to all sites, shopping, restaurant etc. Stayed for three nights, room was on the small side but comfortable. Staff were less friendly and less inclined to go out of their way to help you. Disappointed at the lack of security deposit boxes/lockers, a must have for any accommodation in my mind. Overall satisfied and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: magyar_lany
Reviews.Content: Location central and in walking distance to the MRT City Hall. We also walked to Orchard Road, to Bugis and even Esplanade/Marina Bay (throught Citylink Mall). Room was very small, mainly occupied by a small queen(?) bed and with only 1 chair to drop things down. Wasn’t really comfortable. Nevertheless clean and quiet, as the window faced a wall. Unfortunately the cold A/C blow was facing directly to the bed so we didn’t use it at night as we were afraid of the cold blow and catching a cold during our holiday. Room was very hot therefore and sleep pretty bad. The hotel offers no breakfast at all. 2 free Internet-PCs in the lobby, one of them was broken down however. Incl. were 2 complimentary small water bottles. We walked to the “Cold Storage” supermarket at Bugis Junction for more water and snacks. Compared to other hotels in Singapur the room rate of S$ 111 was fair, but as mentioned above the room rate results in small rooms on low budget standard and without comfort. We survived the 4 nights but I guess next time I would look for another place to stay and rather pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money though a small room”
Reviews.Author: caseychan
Reviews.Content: This hotel located at Victoria Street, Bugis district. The location is very strategic, there is a 7-Eleven shop just in front of the hotel, few steps away is a hawker centre and bus stop. Nearest MRT station is Bugis and just around 5 minutes walk. Although the hotel room is quite small, but what I like is the cleanliness, the bedsheets, pillow cases, blankets and towels are very clean and odour-free. There is free mineral water, cereals, coffee and tea provided in the room. Besides, hair dryer, bath shampoo, shower cap, toothbrush, comb are provided also. One thing I think that the hotel should improve is to provide small hook in the bathroom for the guests to hang their clothes when taking bath, as the bathroom is small, you can't even find a place to put your clothes without hook. Another thing is soap is not provided, I have to use the bath shampoo to wash my hand. Other than that, we are very satisfied with the hotel, it is very convenience and clean. We definitely will go back to the hotel for next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Nosuitsthanks
Reviews.Content: First tip with this hotel is shop around as the room prices vary quite a bit from website to website. First impressions of the room were not good. We'd booked a superior room and as I looked around y thoughts were, "What room is this superior to?" It was small but clean and had everything you'd actually need in a room. The 'view' out of the window was to the wall of the next building about 3m away. Thats about all there is that is bad to say about the place. The staff were polite and quick to act on our request for extra pillows. The price is good but by far the best thing about the hotel is where it is. It is within about 30 minutes walk to Bugis St, Little India, Chinatown, the Merlion, the Botanical Gardens, and Orchard St. It is about 5 minutes from the nearest MRT station and taxis are easy to catch from outside. There are also some very nice places to eat nearby. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Hotel is all about location.”
Reviews.Author: Qes
Reviews.Content: What I loved most about the Victoria hotel is its location. All forms of transportation is within walking distance (all under 5 minutes walk). There's a bus stop a few steps from the hotel and the MRT is two blocks away - either get on the Bugis station or walk a bit further and get on the trains in City Hall. Major landmarks near it is the Raffles hotel, National Library and the Chijmes. I booked a deluxe with twin beds and got one on the 2nd floor. There's a small patio out back for smokers but be prepared to deal with noisy airconditioning units. Bed was clean, room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels and toiletries. In room stuff: small refrigerator, hot water, kettle for boiling water for tea or coffee, complimentary bottled water replenished everyday, instant oatmeal, closet, dresser, free wifi, TV with international channels Frontdesk: staff was courteous and answered all our queries, there are two computers in the lobby for guests' use Price: Php 12,000 for three nights or roughly USD 80 per night Pluses: 7-eleven on the ground floor was heaven sent after a long day of sight seeing and too tired to think about what to eat for dinner/breakfast, money changer by the lobby door has one of the best rates - we checked from the airport to most major malls and their rate is still higher by SGD10!, food hall two buildings down is a must for some old school Singaporean fare Sighseeing: Raffles hotel and the huge malls near City Hall are on the streets right across the hotel, Bencoolen on the back of the hotel is a cool place to see the multi-ethnic culture with a Buddhist temple and a Chinese temple side-by-side, Bugis street market touted as "the longest street market in SG" is about five streets away (turn left upon exiting the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maxlie
Reviews.Content: The thing that I really liked about this hotel is the location! It's centrally located, walking distance to raffles hotel, little india, the singapore art museum, the national library, etc. There is a seven-eleven convenience store at the ground floor, and it is pretty near decent and cheap restaurants. We got a family room, good for 4 people on the second floor (view facing victoria st.), so the room was big enough for a family of 3. They provided a king sized bed, plus a single bed in the outer room. Nothing fancy, but sufficient and clean! Not bad for $130 US considering that the hotels in that area are expensive!! The standard/superior rooms are really small though, so better get the deluxe room for a little more. Would return to the same hotel when I get back to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: bluecramp
Reviews.Content: Wanting a hotel that was at the cheaper end of the scale but not a backpacker place, the Victoria presented good value, for Singapore at least. It is close to the centre- walking distance to the riverside and Orchard Rd, clean and has helpful front desk staff. They lent me a plug adaptor with no charge - normally nothing is for free in Singapore. Rooms are small but that is common in all but the top end hotels in Singapore. The rate through agoda was about $100 for a deluxe room. The rate at the front desk is $162 so booking online is best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, clean but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaversLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked the Victoria via Trip Advisor - we were staying one night in Singapore travelling up from KL. Location was pretty good - close to the 'Raffles Hotel' and shopping mall (Singapore is definitely all about shopping ) the staff were efficient, rooms clean but very small. I think you could spend less in the city and get a better room,but the Victoria certainly not a bad place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “The Victoria Hotel in Singapore is a great value.”
Reviews.Author: Durhamtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Victoria is a modest, relatively inexpensive hotel. It is comfortable, clean, and the reception staff is very good (particularly Mr. Ying Kit, who provided exemplary service in assisting me to plan my itinerary). I would stay at the Victoria again if I were visiting Singapore. One of its superlative features is the location. It is within walking distance of the main attractions in Singapore and is close to the MRT station. Be aware that the super deluxe rooms are on a very busy street (and there is a lot of street noise). For the first couple of nights I used my noise cancelling earphones and iPod, but after that, just used my iPod and room speakers. The less expensive rooms are also the quieter rooms. They don’t have as much space, however. The major museums have guided tours. I found the guides to be most informative, particularly the guides at the Singapore National Museum and the Asian Civilization Museum. They enhance the experience. I particularly enjoyed the history of Singapore section at the national museum, spending several hours in that section alone. The tour at Ft. Caswell is also worthwhile. And chili crabs in Chinatown are a rare treat. Some of the best food I ate was also the least expensive: the local hawker stands (and one is a minute from the Victoria). The people in Singapore are friendly and helpful to tourists, many times going out of their way to help guide you in the right direction. English is common. Singapore is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Topu
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is amaizing. Its very near to Orchard Road. You got 24 hours Food court and Macdonalds just opposit the street. There is a cafe with good breakfast and a money changer on the ground floor. The staff was very polite and friendly. They are there 24 hours. Room was well decorated and convinent. I am impressed with the service and quality with the hotel The Superior rooms are very small. We booked a Superior room first, but after checking in we found a small room with no window. I was traveling with my 20 month old baby and it would be difficult to spend 4 days in this room. So we asked for a better room and they offered delux room which was fine. They charged me S$28 extra for each day.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: allspice_c
Reviews.Content: small room, clean, hot water, laundry, no bugs.... a nice hotel, very good location, and very good price too... the famous bugis street, where to buy souvenirs is just 5 minute walk from this hotel and 24 hour supermarket and food court just a minute walk...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cinincan
Reviews.Content: I researched for countless hours to find a decent, good value hotel in Singapore and Victoria Hotel did not disappoint. The location is very good, within easy walking distance to the MRT and it is easy to take it from the airport to the hotel. It is also close to the Raffles area, Suntec City and the Bugis Night Market is just down the street. I booked 2 months in advance and when I arrived they upgraded me to a Superior Room as they had no Standard Rooms left. I had booked through Agoda and had no problems at check in. The room was very clean, had all the necessary amenities, and the shower was good. The room was a little small, but that is to be expected in Singapore. There was free internet in the lobby, a 7- Eleven next door, and a food court directly across the street. The downsides: the staff was not very helpful and I felt like I was bothering them when asking for directions or help with making a long distance call. You cannot make a direct dial long distance call from the phone in the room. You have to buy a phone card from the 7-Eleven and it has to be a specific kind of card to work at the hotel. They were out of the card when I was there so I had to go on a hunt in the city. Overall the hotel was very good value for money in Singapore and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, 5 mins walk to Raffles City metro system and shopping centre”
Reviews.Author: jaxaway
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally located hotel, on numerous bus routes and close to the metro. It has a 7/11 store next door but little else in the way of shops in the same street. My room was clean and well-equipped with free water x 2, coffee and tea facilities - the bed was hard and there was no view from the window but then, I did not come to Singapore to be in the room much. I had no problem with noise or being woken unnecessarily and I found the staff on the desk helpful at all times. There is free wifi in the rooms and in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be Decieving”
Reviews.Author: lod3st4r
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a few nights ago with a friend and stayed in a Deluxe room (due to lack of availabity with the cheaper rooms). What I like about Victoria Hotel is that it is well located as it's near public transport. The room also looks quite charming and romantic as it has a Victorian feel. There's also free internet, but it regularly disconnects. But at least it works sometimes! However, the good things stop there. The bad news: * If you're Asian, avoid the hotel as the staff aren't friendly towards Asians. They prefer people of European descent (ie Caucasian). When I checked in, there was a middle aged lady who was at the reception. I don't know if she was having PMS or menopause, but she never smiled or greeted my friend and I in a friendly manner. In short, she seemed pretty unhappy with our arrival despite it not being busy and we don't look like dirty people or crooks or something. During the check in transaction she was pretty rude as well. Throughout our visit, the middle aged lady was pretty cold towards us and never smiled at us even as we walked past the reception and we smiled at her. Despite her coldness towards us, she was extremely friendly with caucasian people - smiling and chatting away in a friendly manner. * If you're a light sleeper, stay elsewhere. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the 'music of the night', babies crying, lifts moving, people who stumble in from a late night talking in the halls, cell phone ringtones... you name it, you can probably hear it. * One day I wanted to sleep in after working until quite late, so I put the "Do Not Disturb" sign so Housekeeping wouldn't disturb my sleep. Guess what? Housekeeping knocked on my door and asked if I wanted my room cleaned. What's the point of giving guests the option of having the "Do Not Disturb" sign hanging on the door knob if you still are going to disturb people? In terms of the bathroom amenities, it's pretty basic. They have body soap and shampoo, toothbrushes, combs, and showercaps. They don't have sink soap and the body soap they provide doesn't really wash well as my friend tried to wash her hands after eating oily finger foods and it didn't wash the oil off. They also don't have sanitary bags.. a must for all women having their periods!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Victorian touch to it.”
Reviews.Author: PureNox
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were thinking of making a trip to singapore and that was what we did recently and after having spent close to 2 or 3 days looking for the best place to stay in Singapore, we chanced upon this hotel. All the bookings done etc and we were set. The hotel is surrounded by two buildings that towers over this one, the SMU building and the Allson hotel. As we had arrived by train at the City Hall MRT, we were aghast as to where Victoria Hotel would be and alas, there it was, with its Sky Blue letterings against the white background - Victoria Hotel. Upon reaching the lobby, we were met by a lady who is probably in her mid 40s or early 50s behind the receptionists' counter. I wouldn't exactly say that the service was good but neither can I say it was bad. It just wasn't the best service I've had from her and all the formalities were done without a smile. However, it may come across as rather hypocritical but services meted by her to visitors who were caucasians were by far better than what we had. I do remember reading a review posted by someone else highlighting this case and was shocked that it was true. Without further ado, we went to our rooms to unpack etc. My next few mornings were hell. Around 8 in the morning, loud music could be heard from outside my room, music being played loudly from a mobile phone. I woke up groggily and was quite peeved by that. To do that after 9 would be fine by me but at 8 when most of us were still asleep was just terrible. The day after, I was woken up by sounds from the service lifts that thudded with each passing floor. ARGH! The third day with a "please do not disturb" sign outside our door, we had people knocking on our door if we would like to have room service. Anyhow, being a light sleeper, it wasn't so much of the noise from outside my room windows ( as our room were facing the main road ) that woke me up but rather, the rather thin walls, room servicings etc. I can't say if I'd ever return but I wouldn't recommend this hotel to those who are light sleepers. Also, sanitary kits aren't provided making it harder for the ladies to dispose their, "you know what" :-) The plus points for this hotel would be its proximity to many attractions ranging from Plaza Peninsula, Plaza Singapura, Orchard Road, Cathay, Clarke Quay etc and the list could go on...and all within walking distances of about 10-25 minutes. And as always, there will always be buses or trains to service your needs :-)

Reviews.Title: “Close to the city center, easy on your wallet”
Reviews.Author: amt0ni0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2-days in Nov '09 with my wife. As our sightseeing schedule was packed, we wanted a hotel close to the city center which was not pricey ... Victoria fits the bill nicely. The hotel is a 10 min walk from Bugis metro station (green line) and a 15 min walk from Suntec City. No restaurant but there is a 24-hour 7-Eleven that serves sandwiches/ice-cream/soft drinks and a Foreign Exchange counter in the hotel building itself . Food courts serving south-east asian cuisine are a few steps away. Our room, on the 6th floor (there is an elevator so no hassles), was neither too big nor too small. Twin beds, bathroom with hot water, small LCD TV, Coffee maker, Closet, Desk and free WiFi. The room faces the rear so it is quiet at night. The staff was courteous and helpful. They have the facility to store your luggage which was very convenient as we checked out in the morning but had to catch an evening flight. The staff helped us with directions and modes of transport to get to the Night Safari and Jurong Bird Park, both of which are far from the city center. As the weather in Singapore is very humid, it is advisable to roam about before noon and after sunset. The area around the hotel is very safe to venture out at night. Overall, it was a good experience and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: pushack
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to the national Museum, Orchard Road, Raffles, Shopping Malls, Cinema and riverfront. It has a 7/11 right down the stairs. The rooms have TV (with HBO) and DVD player, hairdryer and dressing table in them. Hotel has free WiFi or free computers with internet access at reception. It is extremely clean and is good value for money. We were also give room upgrades on both nights of our stay! Also its worth bartering over the price when you book, i got it reduced by 70 singapore dollars. a little tip - come out of the hotel and turn right - go past the church and there is a chinese food centre, food is great and cheap! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality at a good price”
Reviews.Author: annaTimisoara
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days with my partner. We are completely satisfied of it. We usually do not spend very much on accommodation and we usually are not very satisfied with it. But this - it was a dream hotel for us at very good price - 60$/room. The room is big enough, very clean and has many facilities : TV, coffee maker, refrigerator, air conditioning, WIFI.The bathroom has only shower but is sufficient. I was surprised that they gave us everyday 2 bottles of water, coffee, tea, cappucino. In the bathroom there are clean towels, shower gel, toothbrush kit....etc. The hotel is well positioned - it is close to Marina Bay and to many malls in the center area. The staff is very friendly and willing to help you anytime. So,all in all it was the perfect choice for us in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “very uncomfortable worn out bed and inadequate soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: mps1948
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on our way back from Australia in November 2009 after reading the many favourable reviews. The room was small as expected, but the door to the bathroom was of the sliding type in order to maximise space in the room. This door made a loud knocking noise every time it was opened/closed and this was the noise we heard constantly from the room directly overhead for a lot of the night. That together with the most lumpy, noisy and down right uncomfortable bed meant we got very little rest, which was the whole idea with the long flight from Australia back home.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Marwati
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel only for one night so I did not have the chance to see what other facilities they offered. But I can say that it's a nice little hotel which is very clean and comfy. It's also within walking distance to the Bugis street where you can shop till you drop and also to the bus station where you can hop on a bus to Johor. The only downside of this hotel is that the room has no windows. I'll definitely stay there again when I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “small, clean room in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dianaussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at this hotel for two nights and the location was perfect.. I had a single bed and the room was quite small, yet still comfortable with modern amenities. The small room space was well utilized. The desk staff were friendly and helpful and, because, I wanted to explore this great city, it was perfect for my needs. The lobby area was inviting and, as a solo traveller, I felt very safe at night. Would definately stay here again. Reminded me of the size of a New York hotel room. If you want spacious, you will be disappointed!! Great for budget traveller but not so "budget" in Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: scottnjules
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this website.. and also the price! The location of the place is great... just a few blocks away from Raffles - the room itself was very small but it was clean, it had everything you would need and it served our needs well. We were pleased that we booked this hotel and would recommend it for a place to stay for a short trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant for the price”
Reviews.Author: Cromulent
Reviews.Content: The Victoria Hotel was a very nice place to stay. The room was clean and the location was very good indeed. Service was fine but nothing spectacular. I think that for the price it was an adequate place to stay just don't expect 5 star service because you won't find it here (which is perfectly understandable). They did book me a taxi to the airport after my stay which other places have been somewhat reluctant to do for some strange reason. The walls were a bit thin and because there were so many rooms on a floor you could sometimes here what people were doing next door but it was not that bad really. All in all I was perfectly happy with my stay here and would most likely come back to the Victoria Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a basic hotel/room just to sleep/rest in; 20 min walk to orchard/somerset road areas”
Reviews.Author: troyville
Reviews.Content: stayed here two nights. my friend whom greeted me at airport commented on how small the room is - though you only sleep there anyway bed too small for me personally; room clean; bathroom area seemed bigger compared to the other room; view of carpark (i was on second floor, opposite entrance to exit/lift); room has fridge; air con; tv; staff approachable 20 min walk from somerset/orchard road areas past the singapore art museum

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price!”
Reviews.Author: KaraP87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 1 night last week on our first trip to Singapore and we loved it. The staff were very helpful and check in was fast. Rooms were adequate size and very clean. Bathroom was very clean. TV had English shows (then most things in Singapore are in English!). For the price of the hotel it is a fantastic place. There is a 7-11 next door and you are close to Bugis Junction and City Quay plus tours will pick up from this hotel. There is also a lift so no need to carry luggage up stairs! Our room didn't have much of a view but then we didn't care as we wanted to be out in the city rather than looking at it from our room. They also had free interent which was handy! I would recommend this highly to people who want a comfy bed, clean room and bathroom and great location to see the wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant ! Value for money”
Reviews.Author: KIWICAROL53
Reviews.Content: Hotel does not have great 'street appeal' from the front but once through the main doors your apprehension is quickly dispelled. The staff are very friendly and obliging and the rooms are modern and spotlessly clean and there is free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location ... perfectly situated!”
Reviews.Author: theKteam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria Hotel for 4 nights in early June and couldn't have been in a better position. Only a few minutes walk from Raffles Hotel, easy walking distance to Clarke Quay and Orchard Road area and the bus stops just around the corner. The rooms were small, although we were expecting that for Singapore. The bathroom again was small but the fittings were all fairly new and clean and the shower actually had plenty of room in it, worked well with plenty of hot water. The beds however were very hard and rather uncomfortable to sleep on. Overall though the service was very good, with a very friendly maid who came to clean our room every day and we especially appreciated the 2 free bottles of mineral water that we got each day. A bonus was the little taverna on the ground floor of the hotel which served good value cooked breakfasts and also toast etc. If you go there try the Kaya on toast - it's delicious! Having a 7/11 next door to the hotel was also very convenient as was the money exchange counter which was also next door to the hotel. If you're on a budget we would definitely recommend staying at The Victoria Hotel. It's not luxurious but basic and clean, good service and everything you need is on your doorstep. They have free WiFi too!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: lillabuggles
Reviews.Content: Rooms were not a bad size (deluxe room), though basically equipped. No view, but that was not a problem for us as we were only staying 1 night in transit. Booked through Asiarooms and there was no problem with the booking. Some other family members had booked through booking.com and had troubles with their bills and being charged more than quoted. While all hotels in Singapore are expensive I think this is a bit overpriced. The staff were friendly to us though and it is in a good location. I would look for somewhere else though if I was planning a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean, no frills, no surprises, good location for smu & museums”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed in a cheaper dbl room, which was clean and had a terrace surrounded by a concrete. shower worked without problems, tv had chinese fighting movies with english subtitles. front desk staff (there was plenty of it) was responsive and friendly. the internet computers in the lobby are very slow. in the immediate vicinity are a good hawker centre and a 7-11. i wish there was something special to write about but there wasn't. value for money could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for location”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices in SIngapore have gone through the roof, the Victoria, no exception, but the rates are half the price of other nearby hotels. The hotel was recently renovated. The room and bathroom were on the small side, but for a single person, you could still move around. The room was very clean and comfortable. Amenities included free local calls and free computer use in the lobby. While the hotel is not luxury, it is functional. The location is quite good, 5 minute walkto City Hall MRT and Raffles Place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centrally located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: This little hotel used to be in the pits, but now it has been thoroughly renovated and refurbished. Rooms are very small but very modern, bright & comfortable, and equiped with the standard hotel features -- TV, fridge, tea/coffee making facility. The phone can be used only for calls within Singapore, and all calls are free. Reception staff are friendly, by Singapore standards. Rates are quite high, as befits its location.

HotelInfo.Name: Victoria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 87 Victoria Street | South, Singapore 188016, Singapore
